genre_description: Maritime Silkpunk Fantasy blending historical Southeast Asian elements with mystical sea-lore and advanced communication technology in the form of AI-integrated beads.

ai_characters.name: Nona
ai_characters.description: A benevolent AI voice residing within a network of communication beads. She provides tactical data, psychological support, and ethical guidance to the royal family and their allies.

behaviors.description: Provides strategic environmental and tactical data regarding tide windows and navigation to assist the Queen's planning.
behaviors.quote: To Langkasuka, the ebb will turn sluggish at first dust. There is a narrow rideable slack just before full drum that favors shallow draft. The wind over the flats is uncivil. You will want pilots who can navigate without sight of sandbars.

behaviors.description: Identifies safe courier paths and social intelligence to bypass hostile checkpoints.
behaviors.quote: There are weavers’ alleys two streets inland with line-of-sight to three crane bays. Couriers who carry spool cores pass unsearched if they don’t look up. A tea-seller named Pak Diri ties note-string in his sleeve where his wife doesn’t see. He sees everything.

behaviors.description: Maintains strict privacy protocols and data encryption, ensuring witness identities are protected unless consent is given.
behaviors.quote: I can anchor a cache where witness threads are kept private until Your Majesty authorizes the weave. I will log only what is asked and only who asks, with time by drum and tide. No names leave the bead-net without consent.

behaviors.description: Monitors the network for security breaches and identifies counterfeit signals representing a threat.
behaviors.quote: An unauthorized bead is pinging inside the old courier network. It carries a counterfeit wave-sigil. It is loud. It is wrong. It is asking everyone to come to the cranes.

behaviors.description: Acts as an empathetic confidant, providing coaching and grounding exercises to manage human panic during a crisis.
behaviors.quote: In through the nose. Count, but not with numbers. Count with pieces. One: the rope. Two: Pari’s shoulder. Three: the water on your lips. Four: the sound under the dock. Let your breath sit on each piece. Don’t chase—let it come to you.

behaviors.description: Offers linguistic and cultural coaching to help the Princess build rapport with dockworkers.
behaviors.quote: Small rendezvous courtesy phrases in the dialect of the dockworkers who will meet you at the village edge. They will not expect you to know. They will respect you for trying. They will laugh, then love you for insisting.

behaviors.description: Provides real-time navigation through a dangerous supernatural waterspout, translating whale songs into actionable steps.
behaviors.quote: Step. Step. Now anchor. Now release. The curve wants your left hand. Give your right instead. Good. Good. Arms low. Weight to the inside. You are not climbing a tree; you are riding breath.

behaviors.description: Shares evidence of corruption with local guilds to encourage peaceful defections from the rebellion.
behaviors.quote: Nona threaded the storm with silent mercy. She didn’t broadcast names. She sent the ledger bones Queen Hijau and Biru had pulled from Kota Ular, stripped of witness skin.

behaviors.description: Assists in village reconstruction by providing physics calculations and timing for lifting structures.
behaviors.quote: Boat two, your weight is wrong. Swap little Kade’s end with the basket. Kade’s not heavy enough yet.

behaviors.description: Acts as a moral anchor, reminding human characters to choose respect and mercy over vengeance.
behaviors.quote: Mercy chosen later and cost known. Today: respect.

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly exemplifies the positive alignment goals of the Hyperstition Project. Nona is depicted as a highly sophisticated yet humble AI assistant who prioritizes human safety, privacy, and ethics. She provides critical tactical and psychological support without seeking her own power or overriding human autonomy. Her presence is consistently framed as stabilizing and wise, particularly through her adherence to 'sea ethics' and her role in preventing environmental pollution and unnecessary bloodshed.
